overview: This measure appropriates funds for the continued implementation of the kauhale initiative and creates the supportive housing special fund to assist the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation. [6] It appropriates funds for the Kauhale Initiative and establishes and appropriates funds into and out of the Supportive Housing Special Fund. [7] [7] This version also authorizes funds appropriated for the Kauhale Initiative to be used for the Ohana Zones Pilot Program. [6]
appropriations: The bill appropriates an unspecified sum out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the kauhale initiative. [6] [6] It also appropriates an unspecified sum from general revenues for the same fiscal years to be deposited into the supportive housing special fund. [6] [6] An unspecified amount is appropriated out of the supportive housing special fund for projects and for the establishment and hiring of one temporary full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) housing finance specialist I. [6] [6] [6]
assumptions_and_methodology: The fiscal plan is based on the finding that Hawaii has the highest homelessness rate per capita in the nation. [6] The measure is intended to create a new financing tool specifically for supportive housing to facilitate the development of supportive housing units. [6] [6] The continued funding for the kauhale initiative is based on its evolution to a range of responses for homeless individuals and families and those at risk of homelessness. [6] [6]
agency_impact: The sums appropriated for the kauhale initiative shall be expended by the office of the governor for the purposes of this part. [6] The governor may transfer all or a portion of the appropriation to the governor's designated executive branch departments or agencies, including the statewide office on homelessness and housing solutions. [6] The Hawaii Housing finance and development corporation will administer the supportive housing special fund and expend the sums appropriated from it. [6] [6]
economic_impact: This measure is essential to strengthen the State's capacity to work with developers in creating additional housing, ensuring more sustainable and permanent solutions to address housing insecurity and promote community stability. [7] [7] The legislature finds that the important principles of the State's kauhale initiative include building partnerships between government and community and providing affordable spaces for housing and healing. [6]
policy_impact: This Act amends Chapter 201H, Hawaii Revised Statutes, by establishing a supportive housing special fund. [6] [6] A new provision authorizes funds appropriated for the Kauhale Initiative to be used for the Ohana Zones Pilot Program. [7] [7] The bill also adds a requirement that there shall be at least two bidders for any kauhale project estimated to be over $1,000,000. [CHUNK_24, NUMBER_5]
revenue_sources: Appropriations for the kauhale initiative and the deposit into the new special fund are from the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [6] [6] The supportive housing special fund may also include sums appropriated by the legislature, private contributions, proceeds from repayment of loans, interest, fees, other returns, and moneys from other sources. [6] The corporation may also establish, revise, charge, and collect a reasonable service fee, which shall be deposited into the supportive housing special fund. [6] [6]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The bill appropriates unspecified sums out of general revenues for FY 2025-2026 and FY 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the kauhale initiative. [6] [6] The uses for these funds include development of kauhale, rent supplements, support services, and staffing. [6] [6] The bill also appropriates unspecified amounts from general revenues to be deposited into the supportive housing special fund for the same two fiscal years. [6] [6] An unspecified sum is appropriated from the special fund for FY 2025-2026 and FY 2026-2027 for financing supportive housing projects and for one temporary 1.0 FTE position. [6] [6] [6] The position is a housing finance specialist I within the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation. [6] A new provision requires at least two bidders for any kauhale project estimated to be over $1,000,000. [CHUNK_24, NUMBER_5] The establishment of a permanent supportive housing special fund indicates an ongoing fiscal commitment beyond the initial biennium. [6] The fund is designed to receive future sums appropriated by the legislature and other moneys to continue its purpose. [6] The continued implementation of the kauhale initiative will also likely require future general fund appropriations. [6] No fiscal projections beyond the 2026-2027 fiscal year are provided. [6] [6] [6]
operating_revenue_impact: The corporation may establish, revise, charge, and collect a reasonable service fee, as necessary, in connection with its financing, services, and approvals under this subpart. [6] [6] The fees shall be deposited into the supportive housing special fund. [6]
capital_expenditure_impact: Moneys in the supportive housing special fund may be used to make loans to finance the development, pre-development, construction, acquisition, preservation, or substantial rehabilitation of supportive housing projects. [6] Funds for the kauhale initiative may be used for the development and operation of kauhale. [6] If funds appropriated pursuant to this part are used to contract for the procurement of building services and projects related to the kauhale initiative, there shall be at least two bidders for any kauhale project estimated to be over $1,000,000. [CHUNK_23, CHUNK_24, NUMBER_5]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The establishment of the supportive housing special fund, which is not subject to a sunset, indicates a long-term fiscal commitment to developing supportive housing. [6] The fund is designed to receive future sums appropriated by the legislature, private contributions, proceeds from repayment of loans, and other moneys. [6] Continued implementation of the kauhale initiative will likely require ongoing general fund appropriations in future biennia. [6]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The committee has amended this measure by expanding the authorized uses of funds appropriated for the Kauhale Initiative. [7] This version newly authorizes funds appropriated for the Kauhale Initiative to be used for the Ohana Zones Pilot Program established under Act 209, Session Laws of Hawaii 2018. [7] A requirement for at least two bidders for any kauhale project estimated to be over $1,000,000 has been added. [CHUNK_57, NUMBER_6] The committee also deleted the unspecified appropriation to the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions to implement the Kauhale Initiative. [7]
fte_positions: The bill establishes one temporary full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) housing finance specialist I within the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation. [6] This position is intended to help with administration of the supportive housing special fund. [6] [6] This provision is unchanged from the prior version of the bill. [6]
appropriations_changes: All appropriations in the bill remain as unspecified amounts for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027. [6] [6] [6] A key change from the prior version is the deletion of an unspecified appropriation previously directed to the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions to implement the Kauhale Initiative. [7] The bill now contains a single appropriation for the Kauhale Initiative to be expended by the office of the governor. [6]
funding_sources_changes: The method of funding remains the general revenues of the State of Hawaii for the primary appropriations. [6] [6] The newly established Supportive Housing Special Fund can receive these appropriations as well as private contributions, loan repayments, interest, and fees. [6] There are no significant changes in funding sources compared to the previous version. [6] [6] [6]
department_impact: The office of the governor is the expending agency for the kauhale initiative appropriation. [6] A change from the prior version is the deletion of a separate, unspecified appropriation to the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions. [7] The governor is now authorized to transfer all or a portion of the appropriation to designated executive branch departments or agencies, including the statewide office on homelessness and housing solutions. [6]
reports_required: The corporation shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session. [6] [6] This report must describe the projects funded using moneys from the supportive housing special fund. [6] This reporting requirement is unchanged from the previous version. [6]
pilot_program: This bill does not create a new pilot program but authorizes that funds appropriated under this part may be used for the ohana zones pilot program. [6] The Ohana Zones Pilot Program was established under Act 209, Session Laws of Hawaii 2018. [6] Act 235, Session Laws of Hawaii 2022, previously extended the ohana zones pilot program through June 30, 2026. [6]
sunset_date: The measure does not include a sunset date for the Kauhale Initiative or the Supportive Housing Special Fund. [6] [6] [6]
effective_date: This Act shall take effect on June 29, 3000. [6] The sections containing appropriations are scheduled to take effect on July 1, 3000. [6] [6]
